place_description: Public garden with tropical plant conservatory, fountains & pavilion, available for private events.

reviews_data.review_text: I love DSBG! I had my wedding ceremony here in 2012. It's a beautiful place and I still love visiting there from time to time.
Very nice. Easy to find and walking is easy. Beautiful.
Xiang Bi $16Gao Jia De Men Piao ,Zhe Ge Hua Yuan You Xie Ling Ren Shi Wang . Jing Guan She Ji He Zhi Wu Bi Jiao Ping Yong ,Bu Gou Ling Ren Nan Wang .

A really lovely space to spend some time, and walk the trails. Huge expansion going on now in the Lost Hollow for kids. The conservatory has a wonderful selection of orchids & bromeliads and benches to sit and enjoy it all. I just heard a new cafe is going in as well. Beautiful place for family and event photos too. But if you just enjoy getting out in nature, you'll be quite happy. Bring a book or tablet and spend some time there

Beautiful place and wasn't busy when we went on a Sunday, has a nice coffee shop when you drive in, has a membership option as well, looks like they're building more stuff as well at the moment, has a beautiful greenhouse with tropical plants, plenty of seating, and a few water pieces as well, they do events here every once in a while like Christmas etc it's enjoyable we need more places like this

Beginning of the growing season
I loved all the trails and they allow dogs. Everything is handicapp accessible too.

We have enjoyed this lovely garden during Spring, Summer and now Autumn-- each season holds new surprises. I love that the garden sets up vignettes for family photos too. Very thoughtful. I look forward to seeing this in the winter. Camellias are just blooming, azaleas are in bloom and it's amazing how much color the garden has despite cooler temps.

Beautiful conservatory. You can walk through the same section ten times and still find something you didn't notice before! Volunteering here is rewarding and every staff member and volunteer is incredibly sweet and kind. Good energy all around. Highly recommend visiting or volunteering here
Beautiful place to be in nature and see some amazing foutains, sculptures, flowers, trees, and orchids!  Definitely go here if u can!
What a beautiful place. They're working on an amazing looking trail for kids with expected opening in May/June. I can't wait!
We had a magical day at Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens.
Estaba cerrado solo abren los viernes

Was a beautiful experience.  For sure, during spring and summer, everything will be more pretty since flowers will be blossom . Have a lot of places to walk around and different flowers and plays during the walk. Also, an orchid house,
That was an incredible experience.
I've been here several times.
Outstanding holiday light show, gift shop and tropical garden are always special. Orchid Christmas tree was a nice touch

Walked the trail - Duke Kimbrell Trail, 2.5 mile lakefront section of the Carolina Trail on the Seven Oaks Preserve.

Perfect way to enjoy nature.

I was excited to visit the botanical gardens christmas lights. The price for three was a total of $78. We arrived and were given a map to guide us. We were also told there was a food truck where we could get hot chocolate at he back end of the garden. We started out, and there were some lights in the entrance to the garden. While we were walking, we noticed numerous lights that were out.  I thought  maybe they were not turned on yet. The further we walked, there more lights out. Made it to the end of the garden. We saw the food truck. Unfortunately, it wasn't  open. We continued on to where all the tropical plants were housed.  Noticing more lights that were out on the way.  Walking inside the tropical house it was really dark and very little christmas lights. It was hard to see anything. Overall, it was not worth the drive or the price.
Lovely place.  Christmas lights very well done. Highly recommend

Saw the Winter Seasonal lights, and it was amazing! Will totally go again next year. The garden has expanded since I was last there and the lights go on and on. They had carolers, and they made a huge tree out of orchids in the main hall. Gorgeous!
Beautiful place and clean!!
Loved the walk through Christmas light show.
I had a wonderful experience at Daniel Stowe Botanical! The lights were simply amazing There were so many different paths to take and experiencing Christmas season.
Very nicely done up for Christmas . Even had some interactive things for kids and big kids alike.  They also had food trucks and hot drinks to keep us warm as we explored the paths.
We love these gardens and visit whenever we can. Make sure to visit at Xmas and the spring.
Hermoso lugar
On this trip we didn't actually go into the garden but it is wonderful. We hiked a couple of the nearby trails and had coffee. Great place for a walk.

Went to Holidays at the Garden and it was so pretty! I really appreciate the effort they put into the beaitiful holiday lights display. Great customer service al well, everyone was really friendly. And the hot chocolate was amazing.
Went for holiday lights, great experience to take friends and family. Just wish the smores kit tasted better.

We went to the holiday event and it was well worth the money. We had a fantastic time, and santa was absolutely wonderful. The lights were breathtaking, and the staff was unbelievably helpful and nice.
The food was great

Found ourselves with an extra day in Charlotte and decided to come here on a nice warm Sunday. Was quiet and very doable for a couple hours. I used my Bird app to see how many bird sounds I could get although it was the middle of the day I captured seven birds in the forest.
Beautiful
Small garden, conservatory,  fountains, children's area. Not the right time of year but still a nice walk in the woods on a sunny afternoon.
Very Beautiful!!! I loved the butterflies in the garden!!
Definitely want to come back each season!
Even during the fall, this is a cool place to visit. Would really like an EV charger or two in the parking lot. But plenty of parking and we spent $36 for two. Well worth it!

A lovely place to explore the grounds which include a tropical plant conservatory and children's garden.  There are great water features and a lovely collection of trees and shrubs to appreciate along the way.
Not much
Very beautiful place to visit I'll be back in the spring when the flowers bloom.

Visited on September 19, 2024.  Horribly disappointed.  The garden is so poorly maintained it felt like it was about to be closed.  I would say perhaps 75% of the garden was not weeded - and the weeds in many areas were larger than the specimen plants.  This was made more surprising by the fact that the botanical garden isn't even that large... I could have probably weeded it myself in less than a week.  Many of the weeds had clearly been there all summer.  Inside the orchid house someone was doing some minor plant work, and the green waste was scattered around on the concrete walk - like the person couldn't be bothered to carry a bucket with them.  Trees and bushes poorly maintained - some had been planted too closely together and had died back, and the dead tree had been removed - leaving a stump and a huge hole in the landscape.  Visible rust on iron work in many places.  Chipped/old paint.  Who manages their volunteer groups?  Do they have any?  I was so shocked I even went to their web site to check their staff - and they seem to have a full time staff of 10 horticulturalists.  Do they walk the grounds?  My daughter had recommended the visit and spent the entire time apologizing.
Beautiful place to visit even in the fall!
Beautiful!
We had a beautiful fall day out with our younger kids. The scarecrow contest was so cute and the staff was very friendly! Can't wait to return for the Christmas season.
Visiting here from crazy LA and loved the beauty and tranquilly. Would highly recommend for a peaceful walk and education.

1st time visiting.  Not much to see as nothing is in bloom this time of year.
I did like the scarecrows and the Orchid house.  The grounds do need some TLC, as mentioned by some one else.
Attended a corporate event for CLT Airport and it was wonderful. Great venue and was able to explore during lunch. Beautiful grounds.
Beautiful garden and a joy to photograph on the grounds whether at a wedding or for engagement and bridal portrait sessions. Spring is beautiful at the gardens. The Conservatory is an amazing space.

Needs to be cleaned up a little bit but overall very nice, we had a great time walking barefoot on the grass path and taking pictures. The items at the store were reasonably priced and the employees were really nice and talkative

Beautiful gardens, lovely paths. We have a year pass (family) that allows entry to AHS across the US. It's a wonderful investment, not crazy. We have been choosing a garden then choosing where we stay.
Save money and go to a free park.

Always a nice experience and a great place to go for a walk and just admire nature. The water features are a nice touch! I really recommend checking out the lights around the Holiday Season as well!!!
This is a beautiful place to walk through and learn about flowers, plants and butterflies.
Beautiful place!
Excelent option for a fall day
So beautiful!

We visited the beautiful botanical gardens on a partly cloudy day in September and it was so much fun. It is a lovely garden, very well kept. The people at the reception are so warm. It was a wonderful experience. Would love to visit it during spring time once.
It was nice and a relaxing place to walk.
Lots of potential: space, trails, botanical displays, butterfly tent, event/venue possibilities.
Amazing spot to walk around and relax. Absolutely loved it.

This was a very beautiful peaceful place to visit. We loved the butterfly garden  There was someone there to educate us on the lifecycle of the butterflies and visual aids that were very informative as well.
Nice garden but nothing special. Good to visit if you have time.
Always love coming here. Lots to see, and everything is gorgeous. Many of the plants are truly impressive. You also get to see a variety of insects, lizards, and other animals if you look closely!
Gorgeous gardens and helpful staff! Such a hidden gem in Belmont.

I was very disappointed with the gardens. Most of them were dead and overgrown. Only the visible gardens near the welcome center were kept up. More than half the fountains were not working or off. It was our first and last visit here. Not worth the money.

If the founder of DSBG could see the deplorable condition this garden has fallen, he would be horrified! His vision, after all, was a world glass botanical garden. It is most certainly not that! Weeds everywhere! Trails to woodland meadows gated off! The Children's section was muddy, and overgrown. We've never been so disappointed with a gardens and we've visited many around the world.
The current condition of DSBG is pathetic.
It is absolutely gorgeous here and the staff is nothing but sweet

Beautiful gardens. The staff has a heart for beauty. What a wonderful job they have done to show beauty in nature. The place is so serene and lavish. What a treat for the eyes. Easy walking paths . Can't wait to go again
Llegamos justo a la hora que cerraban el invernadero para las mariposas asi que no pudimos ver mucho, es un poco caro para lo que se muestra
This botanical garden is just about 20 minutes outside of Charlotte and it is a great place to visit to see a wide variety of plants, bushes trees and butterflies.
Such a beautiful garden! There is enough parking and areas to eat if you bring your own food.
Lots of fountains, beautiful building, (good for private parties/events)

Nice experience!
The place is very good and with excellent maintenance, every garden is ultra green and the flowers are beautiful, keep in mind to go to the butterfly bungalow, you can miss it
We had so much fun with our family! Great for babies - we brought our stroller and got around with ease. Amazing and friendly staff

My partner was there before and always wanted to bring me.    We finally went .I liked it so much I became a member there was a jazz band playing in the lawn also that day.  I had lots of fun .and also to see parents with  the kids enjoying plants was heartwarming. Big shout out to Britney and Erin  there privatol players in the hospitality side or things .and genuinely lovely people.  Footnote  when you buy a membership it breaks down over the year so affordable. We're going to catch the Halloween theme night soon the internet newsletter is also fantastic and the email mailing list very informative yall.
Beautiful, and relaxing place to visit! Very friendly and informative staff and lovely walking trails around the entrance that are free.
Very Lovely, it's nice to just walk around and admire the flowers and different flora. Staff was very friendly as well

Absolutely stunning place!
Amanda assisted in coordinating our elopement and she made my dream come true! She placed us in the most beautiful spot on the garden, was attentive, friendly and helpful throughout the whole time. I couldn't have picked a better place to get married in and couldn't have gotten a better person to help us. Thank you Amanda and thank you Daniel Stowe Botanical Garden. This experience was unforgettable in the most magical way.

I renewed my membership. Care of the garden is coming along, with some areas more cared for than others. Looks like the new CEO is investing in the new coffee shop, not the garden. So the music Pickin on the Porch is free, along with many free trails. Free garden entry after fun run. Free garden evening visits every summer month, I'm told thanks to the generosity of paying members.  Huh? Plus for Members Perks Night  MEMBERS MUST PAY A FEE!  someone kindly explain why I joined? I will save my money next year, since I am apparently subsidizing free admission. Next year I'll visit free.
Beautiful atmosphere!
The design of the separate garden areas was beautiful, and the flow was easy to follow. The butterfly enclosure was especially enjoyable.
Beautiful location

Went for the summer night lights event with my girlfriend after earning a free pass by doing the evening 5K there a couple of weeks ago.

It was a great experience overall. They had a food truck and an outdoor bar near the start of the trail which was nice after a long day at work.

We timed it so it was starting to get pretty dark and ended with it being totally night. The light displays were great, lots of neat effects on the plants and trees in the gardens. It was a relaxing walk and well organized so we didn't get lost. We would definitely try this again sometime.

I really hate writing negative reviews on places but after the unprofessionalism i encountered i have to let anyone looking to book anything here to know what to expect. I recently booked an "Engagement Package" here to do a small proposal to my girlfriend and was not communicated properly about what this actually includes. To start things off the first location they were tying to set me up in was in the corner of this "garden" which wasn't even a garden it looked like someones backyard with no flowers no decor nothing it was just tucked away next to some bushes so i requested to be moved in to the conservatory which there was no problem in doing so. Why recommend someone a corner to begin with is beyond me. Anyways, here is when it gets even better, on their website they advertise the package as "Proposal setup with floral decor" which is not the case, all you get in reality is the lettering. No flowers not even the candles because it was not even offered until i asked about the setup to the planner helping me out who's name was Monica. I sent her a picture of the "setup" they have advertised on their website saying if i can have something similar to it and she proceeds to tell me that "Thats an older picture and we no longer include as many flowers to make it more affordable" and heres the kicker she said if i wanted to bring flowers on my own and decorate that i could, ending it off with a smiley face, and this is why it bothered me so much, I MENTIONED THAT I WAS DRIVING DOWN FROM NY THE DAY PRIOR, WHEN WOULD I HAVE HAD TIME TO DO THIS?! I even told her that i don't even need the 2 hours, all i needed was 30 min to 1 hour to propose and that i could've been compensated that extra time with more decor. To not even try to work something out in any way is how you get negative reviews like this one. None of this was ever communicated to me prior to payment nor is it advertised anywhere on their website that the setup doesn't include as many flowers as before which i can see why, because who would want to just pay for letters which aren't even that nice to begin with. False advertisement is what it is. Such a huge let down, i should have looked at the most recent reviews beforehand. Maybe it use to be nicer i guess but what kind of customer service is this. Now i have to think of something else i can do within 3 days. Thanks for nothing, do better.
Great place for a date, well kept and riveting
Very nice
Beautiful!!
It was amazing to experienced with butterflies at the garden.

The lights were definitely underwhelming this summer. Last year was much better. A lot of areas were dark and unkempt. Doesn't seem like a lot of thought / design went into this year's lights... 2024 summer lights was a big miss for me.. very disappointed.

what a wonderful visit. you can bet
I signed up for a membership!
We truly enjoyed our visit. Lots of walking, of course, and being outside,  it was very hot.
Great place to visit away from crowds and relax. The site is huge, but so much to see.

Absolute gem in the Charlotte metro area! Insightful staff, wonderful flowers and plants and expertly maintained! My little one loves going here every season and seeing all of the plants! The water arch is fun and makes the experience with a kid even more memorable! I highly suggest driving here and enjoying a leisurely stroll!
Gorgeous gardens and helpful staff! Such a hidden gem in Belmont. The Trailhead store is a fun stop for delicious coffee, baked goods, snacks, beer and wine.
Butterflies were awesome.  Orchids were nice. That's all they had. Not worth the money

What an incredible gift we have here in Belmont. There are so many things to do and see in the gardens. Check their website for all kinds of different events, day and night through all of the seasons!
Disappointed as to how many fake plants there were, especially in the orchid garden
Visited with my son! Love all the gardens!

I'm not sure what to think about our visit. We visited years ago and the grounds were much better than today. Lots of weeds and overgrowth were present. Workers were buzzing around but passing by very obvious weeds. We agreed that admission did not match our expectations and that we would not return. The coffee shop and free trails are the best part. They need something to draw people in and better caretakers. Adding a playground and splash pad would be a huge bonus. Something to bring adults in too.
What a beautiful place to visit...and, they have summer concerts !

Really beautiful place to visit.  Some very exquisite looking flowers of all variety. Not really for little kids, I think they have the attention span to enjoy it. Very relaxing place to visit.  Staff was nice too and a the butterfly garden was interesting see as well
Beautifully kept gardens, and grounds.

A membership is worth it! I come here often to walk and exercise.   There is beer and wine to drink while sitting among the gardens.  A place to cool off and rest.   The lights at night are going to be spectacular!
Beautiful venue on a hot day.
The weather is as hot as the garden, worth a visit or throw a party on.
Enjoyed seeing the butterflies and the orchids.  Too hot to walk around on the trails.

The gardens are all beautiful, with so many flower varieties, bees and butterflies, fountains, and a butterfly exhibit. I was happy to walk under the fountain that soaked me and my clothes because it was hot today!
The gardens was peaceful and beautiful.
Everything here is beautiful. There's a butterfly garden, outdoor gardens, green houses, a children's area, and they even let you rent out a space for events.
Was very disappointed to see that the grounds are not taken care of.  There are a couple areas that are nice but weeds are growing everywhere.  Was very underwhelmed.
Bring your camera and enjoy what you are about to experience.
Beautiful place to visit
Had a lovely week day walk. It was small enough to enjoy and not overwhelm. Love the conservatory and butterfly house. Nice fountains
Very pretty walk.  It was a bit smaller than i was expecting, but still a great date location. Even saw a cool little water snake.

I don't know if this is an off season for the botanical garden... but it was a sad garden. The soil was very dry everywhere, the canal had only grime. No running water! The poor plants were dehydrated. I thought we would be amazed at the beauty of the plants.. There were some beautiful flowers but the vast majority of the visit was us trying to find any garden with plush plants and flowers. The gardens just felt neglected (maybe lack of personnel?). Unfortunately I don't think Im coming back, the cost of the visit was not worth it.
Absolutely beautiful gardens. 10/10 worth the visit!

The family and I went over the weekend to the Butterfly Bungalow and to walk the gardens it was gorgeous, we had an awesome time, very peaceful and we definitely will be going back. They were getting ready for a wedding, it is a gorgeous place for many different events. Love it.

DSBG has come a long way since I last visited a few years ago, but it still a young garden and lacks cohesion and maturity in some sections. I remain optimistic about their future, although having a general ticket price nearly on par with far larger and more established botanical gardens in other regions may dampen the appeal for some locals. Concessions around the garden are a nice touch but also expensive.

Such a magically wonderful place to get lost in all of the beauty. You can really tell the staff takes pride and works hard to keep up with everything and I love that there's an area just for kids so that the adults can enjoy the majority of the acreage.  We packed the lunch because we weren't sure but there were snacks and Italian ice along with really good coffee so keep that in mind if you're going and get hungry.
Serene garden. Makes You forget you're 15min from Charlotte

Daniel Stowe Bontanical Garden is absolutely beautiful. Parking is free, and admission is reasonable. The butterfly exhibit is cool and so is the orchid observatory. There are cold beverages and hotdogs served. The restrooms and gift shop are inside.
Beautiful gardens. The Orchid Conservatory is amazing. We went on a Thursday and the garden was not crowded. A varied collection of different types of gardens.
I just paid $18 to walk around a garden full of weed. I could've went to my neighbors house to see that for free.
Gardens needed a lot of work doing on them to make them presentable for paying public. Disappointed.
I enjoyed coming here and being in nature. To see the butterflies and the beautiful plants. I can't help but to feel happy and blessed..

Great for mother's day .
Could use more volunteers.
Beautiful and well kept

This botanical garden is fine. It's not great. There's a few parts of it that are really beautiful and the rest is meh. Coming from the Atlanta botanical gardens, it was very disappointing. We got in for free as members of the ABG. We would be very disappointed if we paid to attend.

Something truly special and stunningly majestic! This place exceeded my expectations and I'm still overjoyed after seeing a lush green and colorful array of flora as if Persephone herself was there tending the land. Walking through the Pergola's onto the succession of spectacular gardens, I was in complete wonderment. The Canal Garden was overflowing with fragrant blossoms and foxgloves lined the pathway as water features and fountains unfolded along the way. I admired an abundance of wonderful plants and sculptures strategically placed throughout in a vivid design. To my surprise, I noticed many plant species that I had never heard of or seen before, forever learning something new. The Orchid Conservatory with the waterfall wall was amazing. (I've always admired glass garden conservatories like the ones found in the US Botanical Garden in DC, Vizcaya Museum in Miami and Isabell Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston.) And if you are an orchid and tropical plant lover, as I am, the conservatory is a must see. The White Garden reminded me of a secret English garden tucked away for tranquility. The children's area called, Lost Hollow, was crazy good. They had a mini amphitheater that reminded me of my visit to Ephesus last year where a reenactment of Cleopatra and Ceasar (or Mark Antony) was held. The childrens area also had a magical/enchanted Fae/Faery like area where you can play in little forest dwellings and king and queen stone carved throne chairs with views of walking trails below. There is so much to see and do here. You can't get bored here. There is so much to learn and explore or just unwind or have a romantic outing. In comparison to my favorite garden, Dallas Arboretum & Garden, I love North Carolina's tree-lined landscape that added a wilderness and untamed backdrop to the garden, giving it a balanced elegantly manicured but not overly groomed appeal. Sometimes it's attractive to be slightly wild and rough around the edges, checkout the wildflowers in the prairie area. As a bonus, this place offers garden classes and workshops, summer camps for children, opportunities for private events, and has two stores (including a gift shop). Special thank you to the lady who welcomed me in and explained the map and noticed I might do a little work and pointed out great shaded spots for working. (She lovingly expressed for me not to work too hard...much appreciated.) Many thanks to the Boards, donors, and staff for the great work here.
Shhhhh...
Children were not well supervised.
My sister in law had her wedding there and it was absolutely beautiful. Great spots for pictures. They clearly designed parts of the facility for such an occasion. Highly recommend
We were a little disappointed. Not a lot to look at. There were a lot of dead flowers and lots of weeds.  The orchid house was also disappointing. Needs a lot of attention. Close very early.

One of my favorite places of all time and it's right here in the Charlotte, North Carolina area. Clean, friendly, welcoming staff and awesome events. Been going here for years and just renewed my membership. Great place for a picnic or an afternoon of painting.
This is a beautiful place to escape all the stress and anxiety, and bring calm into your life again. It's beautifully laid out, and I will definitely be back.
Awesome place. Beautiful gardens and hardscape features.
Pricey but worth it, often has events at both the main garden area and the coffee shop. There's also free trails and a doggy park.

I've visited this garden almost every year since it opened. The garden used to be beautiful and well-kept, with flowers and shrubs blooming every season. It's now a weedy mess, with few flowers, and dead or dying shrubs and trees. There have been some improvements to the natural area outside the "garden" and new paths added inside, but the actual flowering garden is completely neglected. It's so sad to see the deterioration from what it once was.
Came here for a wedding. Gorgeous little venue and garden.
Went to the gardens for a spring wedding. The grounds were absolutely beautiful, especially after an afternoon rain with the colors popping vibrantly!

This beautiful garden is a delight! It's well-maintained and has a lovely conservatory filled with lush plants, flowers, and a charming fountain wall. The paths are easy to navigate, and the map provided is helpful. While the garden itself is on the smaller side, it's clear the staff puts a lot of love into caring for it.

The only thing that could be improved is the snack selection in the gift shop. Unfortunately, our frozen treats were freezer-burned.

We had been wanting to visit this botantical garden mainly for the "orchid observatory." The space and area is expansive. There was a cute storybook to read while walking in the first area. After that it was very disappointing, especially for the money. The water fountains were not being used and looked like a the paths design had seen better days and were not being utilized to their full capabilities. The "orchid observatory" was upsetting to say the least. There was not special or creative about this space to have such a title. Walmart has a better "observatory" of orchids. Very disappointing. Save your money and go to free park.

A beautiful Botanical Garden located in Belmont NC.

You enter thru a beautiful pavilion with local artwork and stained glass. There are restrooms and a gift shop located in the pavilion.

You can stroll thru over 30 acres of gardens displaying local plants,a children's area,conservatory and trails to explore. We visited between seasons so most of the spring flowers were finished blooming and the summer plants were just being planted.

They were busy at work getting ready for the summer season as the trails were not cut and some of the gardens were closed.

There is plenty of parking and you will pay an admission fee. Membership plans are available.

Definitely worth a visit when in the Charlotte area .

We arrived early for the bird watching tour, which we loved and plan to attend again. We then paid the entrance fee and strolled through the beautiful gardens and took photographs. We had an amazing time.

Property grounds are not well kept.   I was expecting for this to be a "wow", it was underwhelming.  I have neighbors with nicer yards and flowers.. it was super disappointing to book a 2 hour photo session only to find weeds and overgrown beds.. mostly a run down place of the past.
250 dollars wasted, no color , hardly any flowers .
Called and spoke to someone and the told me they understand. No one from management called or addressed .
Exceptional new addition of a trail head store, dog park and additional trails.

Don't waste your money. 57 dollars for a family of four to walk around flower beds full of weeds and dead plants. These photos attached are located in the main garden area. Extremely disappointment in these grounds. They appear to have not been touched in years. Will not return.

I tried calling to get more info about closing time, but no one answered on Saturday.  We got there at 245 and was told we had to leave by 4, entrance fee is high enough they shouldn't have that attitude, if we hadn't driven 2.5 hours to get there we would have not stayed.
Beautiful grounds.  Well maintained and lovely buildings.  The orchid sanctuary is beautiful.
Always love the gardens here and the exhibits that they have. Definitely visit the orchid greenhouse.

Don't waste your time.  It's all a joke and it's as though they are intentionally losing money and letting the garden go.  Makes me wonder where the ticket sales and membership fees go. I've nicer plants at a rest stop recently.
Great trails for our dogs. Quiet and beautiful. The trailhead store was perfect for an after trail snack break! They have coffee, wine, beer and lots of healthy snack options.

I love botanical garden and this it was a worth visit even it no has much shadows, but it's full of amazing flowers and fun things to do like the fountain's and the little space with butterflies. I got there in July of 2023.

On April 4 we visited the David Stowe botanical garden. None of the gardens had been weeded and there was garbage strewn out in front obviously, from a party. I would not recommend this place to anybody.
Best garden experience in CLT so far.

Very disappointing.  Lots of weeds throughout the place including around the fountains (in the pavers around it) and in many of the plant beds. May have been the time of year we went (early April) but this place has seen better days clearly needs a significantly larger staff to maintain and clean it up.  Many of the plants and trees were not labeled and some of the plants were obviously unhealthy and lots of dead vines and branches.  The "wings" stations were scant and butterfly portion was closed. And the main building had a musty stench.  I took visitors in town from out of state and was embarrassed.
Spring is here!

We visited the garden as an Easter outing for our elderly mother and it was extremely disappointing.  I've been visiting for over a decade and the grounds have never been in such sad shape.  It seemed there was little effort put into making things beautiful for the spring season.  There used to be masses of spring bulbs and annuals and flowering trees and shrubs  I understand some areas need updating as the garden is aging but it was so sad to see how the garden has deteriorated. There was not even attempts to highlight areas with potted plants and spring annuals!   I hope things improve but I am disappointed and wished I had read a few reviews before spending the money.  Very sad!!

Went today for Easter and the place was a joke. There was hardly anything blooming and it looked like 1/2 the stuff was dead. They also kept trying to charge me full price instead of senior price, claiming they raised the prices but yet the board behind them clearly said senior was 14.95 and full price was 16.95.
Trust me you can go to Lowe's or Home Depot and see more in bloom than what Daniel Stowe has.
TOTAL WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY, GO FIND A BETTER PLACE!!!

Disappointing Visit to Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens

Where were the flowers? My recent trip to Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens was a major letdown. Instead of vibrant blooms and manicured landscapes, we were greeted by a disappointing display of neglect.

Overgrown and Unkempt:  Weeds ran rampant throughout the gardens, choking out any semblance of flowers or well-maintained plant life. Dead plants hung limply, and the whole place had a neglected feel.  The sight of a large blacksnake slithering amongst the weeds only added to the unsettling atmosphere.

Water Woes: The ponds, what should have been a beautiful focal point, were covered in a thick layer of algae.  The presence of dead mice and frogs floating on the surface was not exactly picturesque.

Underwhelming Exhibit:  The "exhibit" was a total dud. It felt more like a high school student's hastily thrown together extra credit project, and not one that deserved any praise.

Pricey Neglect:  Charging an admission fee, especially the hefty $14.95 per person, is outrageous considering the state of the gardens.   Being overcharged for an extra person only added insult to injury.

Save your money and your time!  Skip Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens until they get their act together. There are plenty of other places where you can enjoy beautiful, well-maintained gardens for a fraction of the price.
Going to the botanical garden was a lovely experience not what we were expecting. It was beautiful, my kids enjoyed doing the Easter scavenger hunt.

Went during off season and found ourselves a bit disappointed. Orchid room was nice. The grounds definitely needed a little more attention. While there we did not notice anyone working on maintaining the grounds.

Visiting Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens yesterday, March 26 2024, from Central Florida, I was really excited to see the gardens.  Listed as number 8 of things to do in Charlotte, posted by travel us news, I couldn't wait to visit. What a shock! Instead of seeing beautiful orchids, flowers, plants, etc. I saw a lot of dead, overgrown, under watered and unkempt gardens! Unfortunately, the weeds have taken over everywhere! Dead branches were hanging loosely in trees. The Wings Exhibit was closed and didn't show any signs of opening anytime soon. A mound of mulch waiting to be spread. There were a couple of employees, one riding on a tractor and the other riding on a cart. However, I never saw anyone tending to the gardens. The employee at the front door, who was working the cash register, was nice.

Not sure if it's a lack of employees. However, I would think management would do something about these unloved gardens! At this time, I'm sorry that I wasted my money and time to visit DSBG!

Something is amiss here as the experience we had and what we saw DO NOT MATCH the reviews we're seeing! A recent visit told an entirely different story from the collected reviews on Google...

DSBG was once a beautiful gem and on a path to being a standout in the USA. What has happened?

At first when we arrived, things were looking pretty good. They've put in a new trail system and the entry road and wine-cabin thing looked inviting. Plantings by the lake are pretty and the first impression was positive.

Pulling into the main parking lot however, it was clear that things were not so great. Weeds were everywhere, poking through the pavement and walkways, formal hedges hadn't been trimmed last season (or arguably in a couple of years) and were dominated by dead tips and unmaintained ground bed plantings (despite the spring daffodils pushing up all over the place) were the dominant feature and a gloomy sense of "poor maintenance" or budget issues abounded. Inside the main building, we saw chipped, dirty paint, outdated signage/brochures and handouts and our mention of scalding water in the women's bathroom, when reported to staff, was responded to with a defeated, "we've told maintenance about it over and over." Supplies, chairs and event tables were stored haphazardly and in public view.

The main gardens were not better. BY FAR, the dominant species in the formal planted areas was grass and weeds. Sure, we were there during a shoulder season but the sheer number of freeze-damaged, absent or otherwise just dead plants was shocking. I saw many identifying marker signs for signature plants that were either dead, physically damaged or just not there. The base and structural plantings (hedging/trees/backgrounds) had obviously not been well maintained over the past few years and just by glancing around, it was clear that neither had the trellises, buildings, pergolas and pathways. Even the fountains showed signs that they hadn't been adjusted (or cleaned out) in at least 3 years! Loved the tattered chlorine feeders sitting where toddlers could easily get to them...

Ugly, disorganized infrastructure from holiday event activities litters the landscape and the poorly marked "improvement projects" currently underway look to be "low bidder" or minimal works - lipstick on a pig. Honestly, a visit to ANY public park, in ANY town (maintained by a local government with minimal resources) would have been a better use of our time than our visit to DSBG.

I frankly saw more spring blooms along the highway and in my own yard!

Oh, and the "Orchid Sanctuary." Just wow. It's clear that a failure of the heating system or a major staff problem has happened. 75% of the tropicals in the building showed signs of cold damage or were already totally dead. ALL of the signature orchids had died (except 2 tiny specimens) and their answer was clearly to go to the local garden center, buy $300 of potted orchids and zip-tie them IN THEIR GROWERS POTS randomly around the building. A little moss was evidently used to try and cover up the pots but price tags and bar-codes were still on many of them! All still had their stem stakes and greenhouse clips on the flower stalks and were still in the shipping medium!

On the way out, a stop at the cabin/wine and picnic operation was a disappointment too... While the concessionaire is obviously trying with wine sales, it's a bit disconcerting to look at the food offerings and find rotten "fresh fruit" in clamshells and sandwiches/wraps days past their expiration date on display in the coolers.

For me, there is a clear reason. Leadership. Sure, their past interim director went to prison for drugs but DSBG HAS A MASTER PLAN AND AN ENDOWMENT to build and operate this place! Letting the garden dwindle, fall apart and "go to seed" like this is an embarrassment to the region. This is clearly poor execution on the part of leadership.

An actual treasure here is being destroyed by neglect, poor volunteer leadership and lost vision. Someone needs to CARE.
Always a nice time visiting the gardens

Great botanical garden with friendly staff. Multiple areas were quite enjoyable. There were some areas undergoing maintenance so we missed a few sections. Would recommend a few hours here. The gift shop had plenty of goodies for everyone.
It was pretty but a lot of it was under construction when we went
Outstanding venue for live music

Magnificently beautiful even in the winter!

The enclosed Orchid greenhouse is a great escape from the cold.
The gardens were beautifully lit at night, and the light show set to music was nice.
Great hiking trails
Great staff, cool gardens! Just a little small. It's a perfect spring/summer spot.
Nice place to enjoy the scenery.

We went for Christmas lights 2023, and it was fantastic! We took 3 grandbabies and the rest of the family. Obviously, it was super cold, but the atmosphere, the staff, and the food trucks were all just perfect. All the prices were reasonable for holiday season prices. The facilities were clean and well taken care of. This will be our second trip to see the lights at Daniel Stowe, and we will certainly be back next year for more.

A wonderful experience overall with some caveats. The lights are beautiful for the holidays but some areas are very dark and/or dim. You have to watch where you are going which takes away from the experience of viewing the lights because you may trip over something. There was a small wait due to the time slots given, so I recommend going early to be ahead of the crowd. Parking is free and be sure to check out the small Christmas villages in the room prior to going outside.
Could have been up kepted for the winter.  It was really bare.
Went during their Christmas lights display and had a wonderful time
Christmas at DSBG is amazing. It's our 3rd year in a row and this year we went to see Santa  Totally worth the drive.

Went for the holiday lights display, great night walking the grounds and enjoying the scenery.  Despite all the cars in the parking lot, once inside the gardens, it was so spacious that you hardly noticed how busy it was.  Looking forward to coming back!

I visited the Botanical Gardens while visiting the area. We went to check out the lights. It was something fun to do. While we did enjoy it I will say it was a bit confusing. No map is provided and you aren't given any direction as to where to go. It's also quite dark and hard to see the walkways at times. Everything looks great and the staff we did encounter were very nice. But it would have been nice if there were dim lights along the path to see where you're going. Beautiful lights and plenty to look at. There's also a stand with hot chocolate and other drinks towards the back and you can sit by a fire pit  to warm up. Another issue we had is getting to the main entrance. Our GPS brought us to the back entrance for deliveries only and we had to figure out how to get to the front. There is no signage pointing the way and from the road the main entrance is a ways away. If you go to the back enteance, go back out go the road and tien right, you'll get there down the road. Other than that we did enjoy.
I really need to return for a real visit!
We always enjoy our trips to DSBG. It's become an annual tradition to see the Christmas lights. I wish they would keep the display up until New Years.
Visited the botanical gardens for Christmas lights and felt it was stellar.
The Christmas lighting program is fantastic!  Kids and adults alike will have a great time
We had a great time and love the Christmas Lights
Very nice light layout. Wasn't real big but we had a good time. Got to make smorse with the kids around the campfire too.

The lights were beautiful christmas trees were fun. Yet I was very disappointed not to see a nativity. Later heard someone complained it was removed. I'm very disappointed. It should be in the festivity.
The lights are always beautiful.  I do wish people would leave the stroller and little ones at home with a sitter.
Handicap (wheelchair) accessible, which is wonderful.  We enjoyed the lights for the 2023 holiday display as well as the indoor displays.
Very peaceful place! Will go back again!

Holiday Lights are great. Obvious how much work was put into. Outside the main building is a bridge with blue lights running under it, between a family of deer. WATCH this light show, that replays a few minutes apart. You can see how the music and colors do an outstanding job of telling the story of the changing seasons, thunderstorms and fires and new life. Surprisingly emotional for such a simple and elegant presentation. Great job!

Oh, also, the food trucks are worth a visit, some deals can be found, some a bit pricey. overall the options they have will make it worth skipping the drive-thru for dinner on your way to the botanical gardens
Beautiful Holiday Lights! Also offers food trucks, make your own smores and hot beverages! Love it every year!)
The Christmas lights were wonderful.
Went for the Christmas lights.  It was gorgeous!  The cider caramel bourbon was delicious as well!
Decorated for Christmas. A very nice walk. Don't miss the Arboretum.
The Christmas lights are amazing! It's such an awesome place to visit if you like cool plants and even cooler Christmas lights.

I attended a private event held by my employer, so I cannot comment on purchasing tickets in advance or wait times.  The gardens were beautifully lit at night, and the light show set to music was nice.
Beautiful light show for Christmas must see great walk they had food trucks and beer was a great date and wife still loves me lol
Amazing place...even more so considering keeping it in business prevents more neighborhoods from overcrowding Belmont.
Absolutely stunning, magical Christmas light display. Great fun, very much worth the visit. Wonderful for families
A lovely time at the Christmas lights!

Beautiful, as always and the conservatory is perfect for Elopements!
#myoffociantlife
Oh my goodness, it was a wonderful experience. Beautiful atmosphere and the greenhouse is a must visit as well.
An extraordinary experience.  Well worth the drive.  Will definitely go again

Was nice but after having been to  similar one near Asheville, found this one not nearly as nice.  Lots of paths just partially lit, there are no maps so you're kinda just wandering hoping to see something to see something interesting. No Christmas music playing but instead some kind of ominous music more appropriate for Halloween.
Beautiful Christmas lights!

Went to see the Christmas lights at the gardens. $25 adults, self-guided walking tour. Had some decorated trees inside and a miniature Christmas village. Also saw the orchid pavilion. Lights pretty. Had fun!
Always have a great time here! We especially love the night events!

I visited the garden for the first time the day after Thanksgiving for their Christmas light display. The garden is massive, well organized and quite beautiful. I look forward to visiting several times a year, but most especially when everything is in full bloom. Well worth a visit!
Just did first annual Fun run through the Christmas lights. Amazing!!
They were closed when Google said they were open. There were no postings on the door explaining why, and nobody picked up the phone when I called.
Polu omorpho meros,  pou prepei na episkephteite.
Absolutely fabulous,  highly recommend!
Beautiful place.

Wickedly Rude front desk lady, loud obnoxious and interjects into her coworker's conversations.
Her poor coworker was quietly saying I am sorry to me as this bully walked all over her.
I had been excited to visit this garden and had come a long way from western Canada.
Left the facility, did not pay for admission and walked on the free trails near the parking lot.
Not a very warm welcome for a tourist destination!!!
Will never return.
Not busy. Changing areas for the next event so borders are bare. Enjoyed the walk, though. Staff were knowledgeable and very friendly.
Very beautiful! Went to the Vegan Fest that was there. I will definitely will be going back just to walk around and admire all of the beauty. It was a plus that everyone was so kind
Beautiful outdoor space to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with Vegan Vibes Series

I had never been to this place before but I'm happy I had a chance to visit this past weekend. It's a beautiful space and I'd love to have a reason to book it in the future. It seems the space would be great for accommodating a large or small indoor or outdoor event.

Optimum size with great examples of regional plantings that highlight the seasons. Nice option for a relaxing stroll through interesting displays. They also present activities and events that you have difficulty finding anywhere else
I always love going here to just walk around the beautiful park. I always see something I haven't noticed before.
Beautiful grounds, very pleasant, and informative tour guide.
Beautiful experience.
If you live here then buy the season ticket. What a beautiful area

This is my sanctuary. Very beautiful, pleasant place to clear your thoughts, surround yourself with nature, and enjoy a glass of wine.
Purchase a membership and enjoy the perks.
Best Botanical Garden I've been to in a long time and I have been to a few!

Nice place to hang out
This time of year not much flowers to see
Absolutely amazing everytime. So peaceful.
What a Beautiful place to  visit  relax and enjoy a jazz concert with recording artist Tom Browne on a Lovely afternoon.
Dogs are not allowed. This requirement is not listed on these pages. I have tried to edit info x 2 for future patrons. It will not accept edit.
Wonderful tropical exhibit

Even as we head into Autumn, there are plants and flowers and an abundance of birds.
We enjoyed a Birding walk today.
Beautiful garden
Nice flowers and butterflies
The gardens are beautiful and shouldnt be missed
BEAUTIFUL PLACE

Absolutely fantastic! Went for the summer lights show for my wife and I's 2 year anniversary. It was absolutely breathtaking. We spent almost the full 2 hours exploring. We made sure we to not miss anything! The music and animated lights were an amazing touch. Can't wait to return for more fun events. Next up is the summer concert!
Friendly staff, beautiful grounds
Such a beautiful place! The butterfly bungalo is a must. A very cool experience. All the flowers and plants are gorgeous. Definitely worth the drive out here from the city if you're visiting.
Bonita experiencia paseo por los jardines de noche con luces de colores. Solo le faltan mas luces a las fuentes y en la parte de atras.

Ok so I would like to be a bit critical here but I really believe in places like this and hope to see a better time. Place is Beautiful ! Layout and permanent installations are great. Summertime butterflies all over. The gardening and horticultural minimum is not being met.  I wish them better times and will visit again.

The Summer Lights event, coming out of the main building the lights were great but as you got about one third down the walking paths the lights were more sparse. Disappointing that many of the back smaller water fountains were not lit up with lights. The archway water fountain that you could walk under was ok. I thought it could have had more colorful lights on each of the water spouts highlighting the archway the water was creating. Overall the lighting that was displayed were very colorful. Tickets at $20 per person I was expecting a more fluid flow of lights highlighting all of the static features along the walking path.

We loved it...Beautiful place grounds and facility! Staff was super sweet and informative.

This would be a beautiful place for a wedding!

Sip n paints at The Botanical Garden are a great price and very different than your normal sip n paint. We booked the class through their online website, which was quick and simple to navigate. We did not know what to expect but were greeted right away soon as we entered the facility by the lady front desk. She pointed us in the right direction for the class. I loved that we were able to pick from a book of pictures to paint. The teacher was very friendly and gave us tips along the way to create our masterpiece.  The ticket also came with 2 glasses of wine and a snack not paid for the price. I think it was well worth it and more.
Way better and bigger than I expected.  Lots to see.  Highly recommended for an afternoon.
Too hot! Summer concerts should not start till later in the evening.

Stunning gardens, beautiful orchid conservatory, butterfly house, children's garden , beautiful walkways, water features gift shop. We had the most wonderful day here . Highly recommend this beautiful botanical gardens!!!

Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens is SUCH a gem of a wedding venue. As a wedding photographer, I always appreciate when venues have BOTH amazing indoor and outdoor locations for couples. Whoever you have your wedding at Daniel Stowe, you get just that! The conservatory, surrounding gardens, and ceremony space are all unbelievably stunning. I cannot say enough good things!

It was our last night in Belmont and the gardens were only 1.5 miles from the house we rented. When researching the area I read in the month of July & August on weekends they opened the gardens up at night for Summer Lights. It was a great night being able to see the beauty of the flowers and plants before the sun went down but in cooler weather. Once the sun was down, the lights were pretty and a great way to end our vacation.
Beautiful gardens, several fountains, nice flowers, take lots of love in this heat.  You can do it all in a full hour.
Always love this place, love seeing the Orchid observatory open again!
